--- title: "Fits and characterizes final model for version v5 for outcome pp_hybrid_wk26_outcome" author: "Gaylen Fronk" date: "2024-05-13" output: html_document: toc: true toc_depth: 4 params: study: "match" version: "v5" cv: "kfold" y_col_name: "pp_hybrid_wk26_outcome" format: html: embed-resources: true editor_options: chunk_output_type: console --- ### Set Up Environment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} study <- params$study version <- params$version cv <- params$cv y_col_name <- params$y_col_name ``` ::: Packages for script ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(tidymodels) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 1.2.0 ── ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ✔ broom 1.0.5 ✔ recipes 1.0.10 ✔ dials 1.2.1 ✔ rsample 1.2.1 ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ ggplot2 3.5.1 ✔ tidyr 1.3.1 ✔ infer 1.0.7 ✔ tune 1.2.1 ✔ modeldata 1.3.0 ✔ workflows 1.1.4 ✔ parsnip 1.2.1 ✔ workflowsets 1.1.0 ✔ purrr 1.0.2 ✔ yardstick 1.3.1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels_conflicts() ── ✖ purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ✖ recipes::step() masks stats::step() • Search for functions across packages at https://www.tidymodels.org/find/ ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ readr 2.1.5 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ readr::col_factor() masks scales::col_factor() ✖ purrr::discard() masks scales::discard() ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ stringr::fixed() masks recipes::fixed() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ✖ readr::spec() masks yardstick::spec() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(Matrix) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Attaching package: 'Matrix' The following objects are masked from 'package:tidyr': expand, pack, unpack ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(probably) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Attaching package: 'probably' The following objects are masked from 'package:base': as.factor, as.ordered ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false library(here) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` here() starts at C:/Users/gfronk/Documents/GitHub/study_match ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false devtools::source_url("https://github.com/jjcurtin/lab_support/blob/main/fun_eda.R?raw=true") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ℹ SHA-1 hash of file is "c045eee2655a18dc85e715b78182f176327358a7" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false devtools::source_url("https://github.com/jjcurtin/lab_support/blob/main/chtc/static_files/fun_chtc.R?raw=true") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ℹ SHA-1 hash of file is "b58b9e0adc05e89609ee8bc6f20c39375b262fe6" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false theme_set(theme_classic()) ``` ::: Handle conflicts ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| message: false #| warning: false options(conflicts.policy = "depends.ok") ``` ::: Absolute paths ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} switch (Sys.info()[['sysname']], # PC paths Windows = { path_input <- stringr::str_c("P:/studydata/match/chtc/", y_col_name) path_models <- stringr::str_c("P:/studydata/match/models/", y_col_name)}, # IOS paths Darwin = { path_input <- stringr::str_c("/Volumes/private/studydata/match/chtc/", y_col_name) path_models <- stringr::str_c("/Volumes/private/studydata/match/models/", y_col_name)}, # Linux paths Linux = { path_input <- stringr::str_c("~/mnt/private/studydata/match/chtc/", y_col_name) path_models <- stringr::str_c("~/mnt/private/studydata/match/models/", y_col_name)} ) ``` ::: Chunk Defaults ::: {.cell .hidden} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| include: false knitr::opts_chunk$set(attr.output='style="max-height: 500px;"') options(tibble.width = Inf) options(tibble.print_max = Inf) ``` ::: ### Read in best configuration Selected in 1_metrics_inner (k-fold CV) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} best_config <- read_csv(file.path(path_models, str_c("best_config_", version, ".csv")), show_col_types = FALSE) glimpse(best_config) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 1 Columns: 14 $ n_jobs 10 $ algorithm "glmnet" $ feature_set "scale_ordinal" $ hp1 0.3 $ hp2 0.05645159 $ hp3 NA $ resample "none" $ accuracy 0.766055 $ bal_accuracy 0.5 $ roc_auc 0.6727607 $ sens 0 $ spec 1 $ ppv NA $ npv 0.7685185 ``` ::: ::: ### Fit best model in full dataset ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} batch_names <- list.dirs(path_input, full.names = FALSE, recursive = FALSE) batch_name <- batch_names[str_detect(batch_names, "train") & str_detect(batch_names, cv) & str_detect(batch_names, version) & str_detect(batch_names, best_config$algorithm)] path_batch <- file.path(path_input, batch_name) source(file.path(path_batch, "input", "training_controls.R")) d <- read_csv(file.path(path_batch, "input", "data_trn.csv"), show_col_types = FALSE) d_outcomes <- d |> select(subid, ends_with("outcome") & contains("hybrid")) d <- format_data(d) rec <- build_recipe(d = d, config = best_config) rec_prepped <- rec |> prep(training = d, strings_as_factors = FALSE) feat_all <- rec_prepped |> bake(new_data = d) model_best <- fit_best_model(best_model = best_config, feat = feat_all, ml_mode = "classification") ``` ::: ### Model coefficients **NOTE**: Coefficients are naturally inverted (i.e., positive class [abstinence] treated as first [vs. second] class). Here, we multiply coefficients by -1 to align the direction of coefficients with the rest of our analyses. Once flipped (i.e., as they appear below)... A *positive coefficient* indicates that increases in the feature *increase* the likelihood of abstinence. For example, increases in motivation to quit ("motive_quit_order") *increase* the likelihood of abstinence. A *negative coefficient* indicates that increases in the feature *decrease* the likelihood of smoking. For example, increases in carbon monoxide ("co") *decrease* the likelihood of abstinence. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} model_tidy <- tidy(model_best) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Loaded glmnet 4.1-8 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} retained_vars <- model_tidy |> mutate(estimate = estimate * -1) |> filter(abs(estimate) > 0) |> select(-penalty) |> arrange(desc(abs(estimate))) print_kbl(retained_vars, digits = 4) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
term estimate
(Intercept) -1.1708
co -0.2263
wisdm37_en_goad_scale -0.1130
race_ehr_white 0.1125
motive_quit_order 0.0788
smoke_menthol_yes -0.0784
shp_total_scale 0.0760
treatment_varenicline_x_marital_status_ehr_divorced -0.0741
wsws_neg_aff_scale -0.0662
longest_quit_order 0.0624
treatment_combo_nrt_x_spouse_smoke_dont_live_with_spouse_or_partner 0.0592
tot_quit_attempt 0.0576
dsm5_score_scale -0.0538
wisdm37_tolerance_scale -0.0499
age_1st_cig -0.0476
treatment_combo_nrt_x_live_with_smoker_live_alone_or_only_with_partner 0.0457
age_ehr 0.0408
wsws_crave_scale -0.0386
wisdm37_cue_scale -0.0272
treatment_varenicline_x_tried_nic_gum_yes 0.0267
hdsm_tired -0.0193
race_ehr_black_african_american -0.0173
treatment_combo_nrt_x_asi3_cognitive_scale 0.0172
wisdm37_auto_scale -0.0172
tried_nic_gum_no -0.0171
tried_nic_gum_yes 0.0169
asi3_social_scale 0.0114
spouse_smoke_yes -0.0111
time_around_smokers_order -0.0111
treatment_patch_x_spouse_smoke_yes -0.0082
treatment_varenicline_x_close_smoke_friend_yes -0.0078
time_around_smokers_weekend_order -0.0055
marital_status_ehr_divorced -0.0045
treatment_varenicline_x_close_smoke_friend_no 0.0041
close_smoke_partner_yes -0.0020
close_smoke_partner_no 0.0015
treatment_varenicline_x_used_e_cig_tried -0.0009
treatment_varenicline_x_close_smoke_partner_yes -0.0001
````` ::: ::: 7.74% of features were retained by the glmnet solution (38 features of a total considered 491 features). ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} retained_vars_tx <- retained_vars |> filter(str_detect(term, "treatment_")) |> arrange(desc(abs(estimate))) print_kbl(retained_vars_tx, digits = 4) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
term estimate
treatment_varenicline_x_marital_status_ehr_divorced -0.0741
treatment_combo_nrt_x_spouse_smoke_dont_live_with_spouse_or_partner 0.0592
treatment_combo_nrt_x_live_with_smoker_live_alone_or_only_with_partner 0.0457
treatment_varenicline_x_tried_nic_gum_yes 0.0267
treatment_combo_nrt_x_asi3_cognitive_scale 0.0172
treatment_patch_x_spouse_smoke_yes -0.0082
treatment_varenicline_x_close_smoke_friend_yes -0.0078
treatment_varenicline_x_close_smoke_friend_no 0.0041
treatment_varenicline_x_used_e_cig_tried -0.0009
treatment_varenicline_x_close_smoke_partner_yes -0.0001
````` ::: ::: 26.32% of the retained features were treatment interaction features (10 treatment features of 38 retained features). Of the 354 available treatment interaction features, 3% were retained. ### Calculate and calibrate probabilities Make triplicate dataset ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_patch <- d |> mutate(treatment = "patch") d_combo <- d |> mutate(treatment = "combo_nrt") d_varen <- d |> mutate(treatment = "varenicline") d_trip <- bind_rows(d_patch, d_combo) |> bind_rows(d_varen) |> mutate(treatment = factor(treatment, levels = c( "patch", "varenicline", "combo_nrt"))) ``` ::: Build triplicate feature set ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} feat_trip <- rec_prepped |> bake(new_data = d_trip) ``` ::: Get raw and calibrated probabilities ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # raw (uncalibrated) predictions for triplicated dataset preds_prob <- predict(model_best, feat_trip, type = "prob") # fit calibration model set.seed(2468) cal_split <- d |> initial_split(prop = 3/4, strata = y) d_cal_in <- training(cal_split) d_cal_out <- testing(cal_split) rec_cal_prepped <- rec |> prep(training = d_cal_in, strings_as_factors = FALSE) feat_cal_in <- rec_cal_prepped |> bake(new_data = NULL) feat_cal_out <- rec_cal_prepped |> bake(new_data = d_cal_out) model_cal <- fit_best_model(best_config, feat = feat_cal_in, "classification") # beta calibration beta <- predict(model_cal, feat_cal_out, type = "prob") |> mutate(truth = feat_cal_out$y) |> cal_estimate_beta(truth = truth, estimate = dplyr::starts_with(".pred_"), smooth = TRUE) preds_prob_beta <- preds_prob |> cal_apply(beta) # iso calibration iso <- predict(model_cal, feat_cal_out, type = "prob") |> mutate(truth = feat_cal_out$y) |> cal_estimate_isotonic(truth = truth, estimate = dplyr::starts_with(".pred_")) preds_prob_iso <- preds_prob |> cal_apply(iso) # logistic calibration logi <- predict(model_cal, feat_cal_out, type = "prob") |> mutate(truth = feat_cal_out$y) |> cal_estimate_logistic(truth = truth, estimate = dplyr::starts_with(".pred_"), smooth = TRUE) preds_prob_logi <- preds_prob |> cal_apply(logi) # combine raw and calibrated probs probs <- tibble(subid = d_trip$subid, tx = d_trip$treatment, prob_raw = preds_prob[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]], prob_beta = preds_prob_beta[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]], prob_iso = preds_prob_iso[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]], prob_logi = preds_prob_logi[[str_c(".pred_", y_level_pos)]]) glimpse(probs) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 3,258 Columns: 6 $ subid 20010, 20015, 20030, 20049, 20051, 20072, 20077, 20086, 2010… $ tx patch, patch, patch, patch, patch, patch, patch, patch, patc… $ prob_raw 0.1493997, 0.2469094, 0.1826521, 0.2374785, 0.2381063, 0.254… $ prob_beta 0.1609685, 0.2581044, 0.1957673, 0.2493687, 0.2499546, 0.265… $ prob_iso 0.0000000, 0.2727273, 0.1714286, 0.2727273, 0.2727273, 0.272… $ prob_logi 0.1641436, 0.2560164, 0.1935012, 0.2465153, 0.2471468, 0.263… ``` ::: ::: ### Make AIM 2 Dataset Pivot probabilities into wide format & select only raw probability (based on calibration validity check below) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} raw_probs_wide <- probs |> select(subid, tx, prob_raw) |> pivot_wider(names_prefix = "prob_", names_from = tx, values_from = prob_raw) glimpse(raw_probs_wide) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 1,086 Columns: 4 $ subid 20010, 20015, 20030, 20049, 20051, 20072, 20077, 2008… $ prob_patch 0.1493997, 0.2469094, 0.1826521, 0.2374785, 0.2381063… $ prob_combo_nrt 0.1889869, 0.2509378, 0.2115073, 0.2414024, 0.2381063… $ prob_varenicline 0.1156685, 0.2433404, 0.1463593, 0.2528318, 0.2400227… ``` ::: ::: Join with d & create new variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} set.seed(52592) d_aim_2 <- d |> select(subid, tx_rct = treatment, outcome_rct_wk26 = y) |> left_join(raw_probs_wide, by = "subid") |> mutate(tx_best = case_when( prob_patch > prob_combo_nrt & prob_patch > prob_varenicline ~ "patch", prob_combo_nrt > prob_patch & prob_combo_nrt > prob_varenicline ~ "combo_nrt", prob_varenicline > prob_patch & prob_varenicline > prob_combo_nrt ~ "varenicline", TRUE ~ NA_character_ )) |> mutate(tx_best = if_else(is.na(tx_best), case_when( prob_patch == prob_combo_nrt ~ "combo_nrt", prob_patch == prob_varenicline ~ "varenicline", prob_combo_nrt == prob_varenicline ~ sample(c("combo_nrt", "varenicline"), 1), TRUE ~ NA_character_ ), tx_best)) |> mutate(prob_best = case_when( tx_best == "patch" ~ prob_patch, tx_best == "combo_nrt" ~ prob_combo_nrt, tx_best == "varenicline" ~ prob_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ )) |> mutate(tx_best = factor(tx_best, levels = c( "patch", "varenicline", "combo_nrt"))) |> mutate(tx_match = if_else(tx_best == tx_rct, TRUE, FALSE)) |> left_join(d_outcomes, by = "subid") |> select(-pp_hybrid_wk26_outcome, -pp_hybrid_wk1_outcome, -pp_hybrid_yr3_outcome) |> # already in there from d rename(outcome_rct_wk12 = pp_hybrid_wk12_outcome, outcome_rct_wk4 = pp_hybrid_wk4_outcome, outcome_rct_wk52 = pp_hybrid_wk52_outcome) |> relocate(subid, tx_rct, tx_best, tx_match, prob_best, starts_with("outcome"), starts_with("prob")) glimpse(d_aim_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} Rows: 1,086 Columns: 12 $ subid 20010, 20015, 20030, 20049, 20051, 20072, 20077, 2008… $ tx_rct patch, combo_nrt, patch, varenicline, patch, combo_nr… $ tx_best combo_nrt, combo_nrt, combo_nrt, varenicline, varenic… $ tx_match FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, TRUE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,… $ prob_best 0.1889869, 0.2509378, 0.2115073, 0.2528318, 0.2400227… $ outcome_rct_wk26 smoking, smoking, smoking, abstinent, smoking, smokin… $ outcome_rct_wk4 "smoking", "smoking", "smoking", "smoking", "smoking"… $ outcome_rct_wk12 "smoking", "smoking", "smoking", "abstinent", "smokin… $ outcome_rct_wk52 "smoking", "abstinent", "smoking", "abstinent", "smok… $ prob_patch 0.1493997, 0.2469094, 0.1826521, 0.2374785, 0.2381063… $ prob_combo_nrt 0.1889869, 0.2509378, 0.2115073, 0.2414024, 0.2381063… $ prob_varenicline 0.1156685, 0.2433404, 0.1463593, 0.2528318, 0.2400227… ``` ::: ::: Quick EDA checks ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # confirm logic worked as expected head(d_aim_2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 6 × 12 subid tx_rct tx_best tx_match prob_best outcome_rct_wk26 1 20010 patch combo_nrt FALSE 0.189 smoking 2 20015 combo_nrt combo_nrt TRUE 0.251 smoking 3 20030 patch combo_nrt FALSE 0.212 smoking 4 20049 varenicline varenicline TRUE 0.253 abstinent 5 20051 patch varenicline FALSE 0.240 smoking 6 20072 combo_nrt varenicline FALSE 0.264 smoking outcome_rct_wk4 outcome_rct_wk12 outcome_rct_wk52 prob_patch prob_combo_nrt 1 smoking smoking smoking 0.149 0.189 2 smoking smoking abstinent 0.247 0.251 3 smoking smoking smoking 0.183 0.212 4 smoking abstinent abstinent 0.237 0.241 5 smoking smoking smoking 0.238 0.238 6 smoking smoking smoking 0.255 0.262 prob_varenicline 1 0.116 2 0.243 3 0.146 4 0.253 5 0.240 6 0.264 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # check on variability of best tx janitor::tabyl(d_aim_2$tx_best) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} d_aim_2$tx_best n percent patch 0 0.0000000 varenicline 305 0.2808471 combo_nrt 781 0.7191529 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # check on variability of tx matching janitor::tabyl(d_aim_2$tx_match) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} d_aim_2$tx_match n percent FALSE 637 0.5865562 TRUE 449 0.4134438 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} # variability of matching within assignned (RCT) tx d_aim_2 |> group_by(tx_rct) |> tab(tx_match) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 5 × 4 # Groups: tx_rct [3] tx_rct tx_match n prop 1 patch FALSE 241 1 2 varenicline FALSE 292 0.689 3 varenicline TRUE 132 0.311 4 combo_nrt FALSE 104 0.247 5 combo_nrt TRUE 317 0.753 ``` ::: ::: Write out ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_aim_2 |> write_csv(file.path(path_models, str_c("aim_2_", version, "_", y_col_name, ".csv"))) # d_aim_2 |> # write_csv(here("/objects", str_c("aim_2_", version, "_", # y_col_name, ".csv"))) ``` ::: ### Validity check: Model Calibration Make wide format for all calibrated probabilities ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} all_probs_wide <- probs |> rename_with(~ str_replace(.x, "prob_", ""), .cols = starts_with("prob_")) |> pivot_wider( names_from = tx, values_from = c(raw, beta, iso, logi), names_glue = "{.value}_{tx}" ) ``` ::: Set up validity check data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_valid <- d_aim_2 |> select(subid, tx_rct, outcome_rct_wk26) |> left_join(all_probs_wide, by = "subid") |> mutate(beta = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ beta_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ beta_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ beta_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ ), raw = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ raw_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ raw_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ raw_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ ), isotonic = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ iso_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ iso_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ iso_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ ), logistic = case_when( tx_rct == "patch" ~ logi_patch, tx_rct == "combo_nrt" ~ logi_combo_nrt, tx_rct == "varenicline" ~ logi_varenicline, TRUE ~ NA_real_ )) |> select(subid, outcome_rct_wk26, beta, raw, isotonic, logistic) ``` ::: Compare mean abstinence from RCT to predicted probabilities for RCT tx across calibrations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_valid |> mutate(outcome_rct = if_else(outcome_rct_wk26 == "abstinent", 1, 0)) |> summarize(mean_rct = mean(outcome_rct), mean_beta = mean(beta), mean_iso = mean(isotonic), mean_logi = mean(logistic), mean_raw = mean(raw)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ```{style="max-height: 500px;"} # A tibble: 1 × 5 mean_rct mean_beta mean_iso mean_logi mean_raw 1 0.247 0.252 0.221 0.252 0.247 ``` ::: ::: Raw probabilities appear to match the outcome best. #### Plots Pivot data longer for required format ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_plot <- d_valid |> pivot_longer( cols = c(beta, raw, isotonic, logistic), names_to = "method", values_to = ".pred_abstinent" ) ``` ::: Make plots by calibration method ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_plot |> cal_plot_breaks(truth = outcome_rct_wk26, estimate = .pred_abstinent, .by = method) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](fit_final_model_26wk_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} d_plot |> cal_plot_windowed(truth = outcome_rct_wk26, estimate = .pred_abstinent, .by = method) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](fit_final_model_26wk_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-2.png){width=672} ::: ::: Beta and logistic start off well but then quickly deviate and have a minimized range. Isotonic jumps fully from 0 to 1. Raw has some deviations in the upper quadrant of the graphs, but seems overall to follow the lines best for longest.
